docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 9:23 p.m. | New York City health authorities investigated the death of a 16-month-old child as a possible case of swine flu on Tuesday, before concluding in the evening that tests of nasal swabs from the child did not indicate swine flu.
docs.abstract: The mayor also confirmed that there were four confirmed and four probable cases of swine flu at Rikers Island.
docs.snippet: The mayor also confirmed that there were four confirmed and four probable cases of swine flu at Rikers Island.

byline.original: By SEWELL CHAN and KAREN ZRAICK

docs.abstract: Politico: Health care could soon go the way of the automobile, with users having no choice but to buy insurance coverage. Within four years, every American could be required to own health insurance or pay their way through tax penalties. The odds of such a sea change rose last week when chief Democratic and Republican [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: The stork keeps close tabs on world events. There's a blackout in Houston, and nine months later maternity wards are full. There's a nationwide recession, and for the duration fewer babies are born.
docs.abstract: How the recession is affecting people and their decisions about having children.
docs.snippet: How the recession is affecting people and their decisions about having children.

docs.lead_paragraph: A detailed analysis of state-provided data has found racial disparities in health care among the three million New Yorkers in the state's public insurance programs.

headline.main: Racial Disparities Found Under State Health Plans

docs.abstract: A new analysis reveals racial disparities in health care results among the three million low-income New Yorkers on public insurance plans.
docs.snippet: A new analysis reveals racial disparities in health care results among the three million low-income New Yorkers on public insurance plans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. David A. Paterson urged the State Senate on Sunday to take swift action on legislation that would allow same-sex couples to marry, signaling that he intends to increase pressure on lawmakers as the end of the 2009 legislative session approaches.

headline.main: In Midtown, Opposing Rallies on Same-Sex Marriage
